title: Music forum
content:
Can we look at getting a "Music and related tools" forum up? There's quite a few threads around with the place with remixes, or topics about getting/using music from games, or new tools, etc - I don't know if it's a passing phase but it might be nice to separate it out.------------------
[url=http://www.szevvy.net]www.szevvy.net[/url], for all your Wombat needs. You know you want to.
A member of the LevelLord fan club.

title: Re: Music forum
content:
In my opinion it isn't necessary, especially as this is a Keen forum and there isn't that much stuff about Keen music. I think the classic games section is good enough for that stuff.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Music forum
content:
Can go into Keen-related, just like all the other stuff.____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: Re: Re:
content:
Ah. I usually lock the topics for a while, and then remove them later, so people can see what has happened. But it might be I delete them too early, so not everyone has time to see they're locked first, like in this case.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Re:
content:
Rumour has it that in some phpBB-based forums, the moderators and admins have an invisible "spam" forum, where they move spam and other unwanted* content before permanently removing it from the database. Locked threads in other forums are just let sink down to the deeps of hell.

* you can imagine what I'm referring to, as mods and admins you are.------------------------------
[url=http://shadowm2006.sitesled.com/]My website[/url]
[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm20.showMessage?topicID=12.topic]Get Windows/Linux native LModKeen 2 with integrated FIN2BMP![/url]. You know you want to.

title: Re: Re:
content:
If I ran a popular forum I would sticky humorous, either intentionally or unintentionally, threads. It would be the reverse of a "Spam" folder.

Thank God I don't run a popular forum.-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Re:
content:
"Rumour has it that in some phpBB-based forums, the moderators and admins have an invisible "spam" forum, where they move spam and other unwanted* content before permanently removing it from the database."
Why make it so complicated? It's a lot easier to just delete it right away, and I don't think there has been a case that would've required every admins and mods approval that 'yes, that's spam / unwanted [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img] '. I really can't see any advantage in such invisible section.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
